etymology.description: Depicts two blocks of metal -> later connected as two vertebrae -> borrowed to represent 'spine' and music notes
etymology.interpretation: Initially depicting two separate metal blocks, 呂(呂) (lǚ, "blocks of metal") evolved to represent anatomy and music notes due to phonetic borrowing, showcasing its flexibility in borrowing meanings.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在遗址中发现呂(考古學家在遺址中發現呂)，验证了古代铸造方法(驗證了古代鑄造方法)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zài yízhǐ zhōng fāxiàn lǚ, yànzhèngle gǔdài zhùzào fāngfǎ.
examples.english: Archaeologists discovered blocks of metal at the ruins, confirming ancient casting methods.

examples.chinese: 呂(呂)体现了古代金属工艺(體現了古代金屬工藝)。
examples.english: Blocks of metal embody the ancient metalworking craft.
